alert.note: Alert for Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 6:48AM AKST until February 23 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 9 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches near Sutton and toward Hatcher Pass. Total snow accumulation 1 to 3 inches in Palmer and Wasilla. * WHERE...Matanuska Valley. * WHEN...From 6 AM to 9 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and afternoon commutes Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will begin early Thursday morning. The snow is likely to mix with rain by late morning as warm southeasterly winds develop over Palmer and bring warm air into the Wasilla area as well. Precipitation is expected to turn back to all snow late in the afternoon as winds diminish.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
